H0.text: when was coffee first made into a drink. 9th century

H1.text: when was coffee first made into a drink. 12th century

H2.text: when was coffee first made into a drink. 10th century

H3.text: when was coffee first made into a drink. 15th century

A4.text: a 9th-century Ethiopian goatherder, Kaldi, who, noticing the energizing effects when his flock nibbled on the bright red berries of a certain bush, chewed on the fruit himself.

A5.text: Sufi Muslims in the 15th century used it to aid concentration during night prayers.

A6.text: There is no confirmed evidence, either historical or archaeological, of coffee as a drink being consumed before the 15th century.

A7.text: By the late 15th century, coffee drinking was well established among Sufi communities in Yemen.
